meanings.definition: A large airport equipped to handle jet aircraft.
meanings.sent1: The bustling jetport welcomed travelers from around the world.
meanings.sent2: I flew into the jetport to attend a business conference.
meanings.sent3: The lost luggage at the jetport decided to go on a solo adventure.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a jetport of ideas, with planes taking off in all directions.
meanings.sent5: The jetport hummed with the energy of departing and arriving flights.

meanings.sent1: We will jetport the cargo to its destination swiftly.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to jetport their employees to the overseas branch.
meanings.sent3: The superhero jetported across the city to save the day.
meanings.sent4: His words jetported her back to that unforgettable moment.
meanings.sent5: The futuristic technology allowed them to jetport to different planets.
